course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Managing CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility)
course.description: This course will focus on specific CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) issues facing companies today. Along with changing attitudes, new global regulatory CSR requirements are increasingly putting firms under pressure to demonstrate positive social and environmental impacts, while maintaining their commitments to investors. Students will investigate how actual firms are managing these pressures while continuing to address the needs of their stakeholders. Incorporating aspects of the benchmark standards such as the GRI and various ESG (Environmental Social Governance) initiatives will help students to strengthen their own knowledge, skill, and attitudes in this area. The course has an embedded project, with direct links to one or more businesses, which will give students the necessary practical grounding for effectively understanding the challenges of CSR in the contemporary business environment.

reviews.author: abpuma
reviews.comment_content:
1. A Conceptual CSR Model
2. Drivers of CSR
3. Management Model of CSR
4. Stakeholder Engagement
5. Economic Responsibility
6. Environmental Responsibility
7. Social Responsibility - Human Resources & Supply Chain
8. Materiality Assessment
9. ESG Reporting Initiatives
10. Reporting on Performance (GRI Standards)
11. Communicating CSR

The topics and material are very well-chosen. Pay special attention to GRI Standards and materiality assessment, those are very useful topics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mary is one of the best professors I've had at HKUST. Her teaching is very straightforward and relevant. Her slides are also quite useful. She loves engaging her students and since it's a small class, be prepared to participate in class discussions and Canvas discussions. She speaks monotonously sometimes but it shouldn't be a problem.

She also makes sure everyone gets a chance to speak. Also, she's open with students so you'll be treated as an adult. She really appreciates people who contribute meaningfully in class.

Midterm: 18/20 (Mean 15.5)

reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is pretty standard of a 3-credit course.

Although the assessments on the left seem like a lot of work, it's actually not bad. For news media sharing, you just have to find 1 article and manage the Canvas discussion. In online discussion, you have to post 2 short comments/week on other people's news articles. Case study analysis is a 4-page paper. The deadlines are quite flexible because: for news sharing, the TA assigns different weeks to everyone, and there are 4 opportunities to submit the case analysis during the semester.

Midterm is okay and GRI standards quiz is very easy to score full marks in. You just need to work hard for the group project, and you know your company from the first lecture.

The content are too scattered like simply putting a lot of concepts together, and are not really useful for finishing the assignments.

- Introduction
- Greenwashing
- Stakeholder engagement

- Reporting
- CSR and CSV

reviews.comment_teaching:
Very inconvenient lesson time (7pm-10pm), would ask the class to vote for having a break or not, in my case there's no break and it is extremely tiring to keep focused for 2.5 hours

Quite harsh, straight cut if your presentation is overran, one of the group was directly asked if they have used ChatGPT in QnA session

Would pick someone to answer questions from the name list (sometimes), and if you answer his questions, it is likely to have follow up questions

The lectures are slightly different from the syllabus as he skipped 1-2 lessons
reviews.comment_grading:
Very bad grading
